--- # listing: # id: news-listing # contents: news # date-format: iso # sort: "date desc" # type: default # max-items: 3 # image-placeholder: "images/logo.png" # categories: false # sort-ui: false # filter-ui: false format: html: page-layout: full --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/logo.png){fig-align='center' width=200} ::: ::: The Psychological Science Accelerator (PSA) is a globally distributed network of researchers that pool intellectual and material resources to accelerate the accumulation of rigorous knowledge in psychological science. We believe that many of the world's biggest challenges cannot be addressed by a single researcher or small team. We thus seek to leverage [big team science](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-022-00150-2) to address big questions rooted in theory and/or real-world problems. For example, of the 12+ projects in our [study portfolio](projects.html), we have: - Tested whether COVID-19-related cognitive framing manipulations impact emotions, behaviors, attitudes, and well-being around the world. - Examined cultural and situations forces that shape moral dilemma judgments. - Examined the extent to which stereotype threat impacts academic performance among African American college students. ------------------------------------------------------------------------
![](images/clipboard-2354168444.png) Check out our collaboration with Gorilla! or view our [blog post](https://psysciacc.org/news/2025-03-15_Gorilla.html).
